title: Irno (river)
description: The Irno river is a river of Campania that flows into the Tyrrhenian Sea. While its ancient name is unknown, the river valley is the site of first millennium B.C. settlement and also the site of numerous clay beds exploited for pottery production.

properties.description: Representative modern location of river course based on OpenStreetMap.
properties.title: OSM location of Fiume Irno
